Home » Uncategorized » Hon. Suhaimi Gafar talks about the revision of guidelines for public housing in Brunei

Hon. Suhaimi Gafar talks about the revision of guidelines for public housing in Brunei

December 5, 2019 Rogelio Pennock 0 Uncategorized

167
SHARES
ShareTweet

The 2019 edition of the Planning Guidelines and the Requirements for the Extension / Renovation of Existing Homes in the National Housing Scheme were introduced to replace the previous version released 12 years ago.

The Ministry of Development has revised a variety of planning guidelines to enhance land use and safety, including the expansion and rehabilitation of public housing. 

Minister of Development YB Dato Seri Setia Hj Suhaimi Hj Gafar said that efforts are aimed at creating systematic, inclusive, sustainable and competitive development while at the same time facilitating business ease – particularly in the construction licensing sector.

Earlier this year, more than 18,000 cases of illegal extensions and renovations of existing residences have been recorded under the National Housing Scheme. Homeowners under the National Housing Scheme are required to obtain permission from the government if they wanted to extend or renovate their homes.

The Ministry of Town and Country Planning has also launched guidelines on subdivision and/or consolidation of land, guidelines, and standards for industrial development, as well as additional guidelines on density and land-use ratios for housing development. All the recommendations are part of the Department’s efforts to improve land use and to achieve effective project management.

The Department has unveiled two websites that promise to make it easy for law firms to submit applications and to look for information on land-use planning. The Planning and Development Information System (i-PK) is an online platform for law firms to apply land and legal search requests, offering planning and development information. The Department intends to make the application process simpler for consumers through the program.

It is an effort of the Department to exchange information on the planning regulations that can be used as a resource for the identification of the types of development permitted within a particular planning zone. The aim is to make this easier for the public to plan their creation in line with national policies.
